itemListElement.name: Instant Pot Apple Cider Recipe (stove-top option)

@graph.name: Instant Pot Apple Cider Recipe
@graph.description: Easy Instant Pot Apple Cider Recipe. 7 Ingredients. Serve this spiced apple cider warm or cold. Stove-top option. Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free pressure cooker Homemade Mulled Apple Cider drink

video.name: INSTANT POT APPLE CIDER | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Easy Instant Pot Apple Cider Recipe. 7 Ingredients. Serve this spiced apple cider warm or cold. Stove-top option. 
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/10/instant-pot-apple-cider-recipe.html

Spiced Drinks are what I crave in the cooler fall and winter months. This Apple Cider fits right in. Just 7 Ingredients!Put everything in an Instant Pot pressure cooker, pressure cook, strain and done! I love the cider warm, but it is also amazing served chilled with ice.

This homemade mulled apple cider also stores well. Refrigerate for upto 5 days or freeze. Lets whip up a batch of this cider! Make it spiked with some rum, whiskey, wine or tequila. Change up the fruits with seasonal fruits for variation.Spiced Drinks are what I crave in the cooler fall and winter months. This Apple Cider fits right in. Just 7 Ingredients! Put everything in an Instant Pot pressure cooker, pressure cook, strain and done! I love the cider warm, but it is also amazing served chilled with ice.

This homemade apple cider also stores well. Refrigerate for upto 5 days or freeze. Lets whip up a batch of this cider! Make it spiked with some rum, whiskey, wine or tequila. Change up the fruits with seasonal fruits for variation.


#veganricha #applecider #easyveganrecipes #instantpot #instantpotapplecider  

MY BOOKS:
INDIAN KITCHEN (Best-Seller):  https://veganricha.com/vegan-richas-indian-kitchen-cookbook
EVERYDAY KITCHEN: https://veganricha.com/vegan-richas-everyday-kitchen
Both have about 150 Recipes each. With many gluten-free, nut-free, soy-free recipes and options listed with recipes. Available everywhere Internationally as well.

Music: Sky by Markvard

Follow:

recipeIngredient: 4  apples (, cored and sliced into cubes(gala, fuji and other red sweet apples))
Optional flavor add ins: (1/4 tsp nutmeg or all spice)
5 to 6  dates (or 1 - 2 tbsp sugar or other sweetener,  optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Add all in the ingredients to the pot. Mix with a spatula. Close the lid and pressure cook for 11 mins at high pressure,
recipeInstructions.name: Add all in the ingredients to the pot. Mix with a spatula. Close the lid and pressure cook for 11 mins at high pressure,

recipeInstructions.text: Let the pressure release naturally once the cooking cycle is complete. Open the lid and let it cool for a few minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the pressure release naturally once the cooking cycle is complete. Open the lid and let it cool for a few minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the mixture to a strainer in batches, and press and mash and press. Remove as much liquid as possible from the mix along with some smooth pulp.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the mixture to a strainer in batches, and press and mash and press. Remove as much liquid as possible from the mix along with some smooth pulp.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the cider hot or cold. Store: Refrigerate in a closed container for upto 5 days or freeze for upto 2 months.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve the cider hot or cold. Store: Refrigerate in a closed container for upto 5 days or freeze for upto 2 months.

recipeInstructions.text: Saucepan(stovetop): Add all the ingredients to a saucepan. Cook for 2 hours, partially covered over medium low heat. Transfer the mixture to a strainer and press and mash to strain the cider.
recipeInstructions.name: Saucepan(stovetop): Add all the ingredients to a saucepan. Cook for 2 hours, partially covered over medium low heat. Transfer the mixture to a strainer and press and mash to strain the cider.
